subject: Re: [junit] Why no assertNotEquals()
msgSnippet: Avoid the problem entirely. Use GSBase s EqualsTester . For my part, I wouldn t mind seeing assertNotEquals(), although I don t want it too often, I do want
messageBody:
Avoid the problem entirely. Use GSBase's "EqualsTester".

For my part, I wouldn't mind seeing assertNotEquals(), although I don't want it too often, I do want it from time to time.

Take care.

>So said Erik Mattsson on 4/25/2003 --------------------
>Is there any special reasons that there are no assertNotEquals() methods?
>
>Sometimes I want to make sure that the equals() method is implemented
>correctly and therefore creating two objects that arent equal and test
>them.
>
>Now I have to use the assertFalse in order to get the functionality I need.
>
>assertFalse("Msg", ! obj1.equals( obj2 ) );
>
>
>Any ideas?
>//Erik
